item.title: Forgotten Fortune: The Story of the Pair A Dice Hotel and Casino - Vintage Las Vegas History
item.description:
A Brief Spark on North Las Vegas Boulevard

The Pair-A-Dice Club casino, a name largely absent from modern Vegas lore, quietly entered the scene in 1956. Located at 2067 North Las Vegas Boulevard, it wasn’t situated on the famous Strip, but rather in the burgeoning North Las Vegas area, which was rapidly developing alongside the city’s explosive growth. The late 50s and early 60s were a period of frantic expansion for Las Vegas, and countless small casinos and entertainment venues popped up, all vying for a piece of the burgeoning tourism pie. While details about its early ownership and specific offerings are scarce – a common challenge with many of these forgotten establishments – the Pair-A-Dice represented that spirit of opportunity and risk that defined early Las Vegas.
